wait_node_client.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 import actionlib
5 from wait_action.msg import *
6 
7 
8 if __name__ == '__main__':
9 
10  rospy.init_node("wait_node_client")
11 
12  # wait for simulated time to kick in as rospy.get_rostime() is 0 until first clock message received
13  while not rospy.is_shutdown() and rospy.get_rostime().secs == 0:
14  pass
15 
16 
17  client = actionlib.SimpleActionClient('wait_action', WaitAction)
18  client.wait_for_server()
19 
20  wait_secs = 5
21 
22  # wait a duration
23  goal = WaitGoal(wait_duration=rospy.Duration(wait_secs))
24  client.send_goal(goal)
25  client.wait_for_result()
26 
27  # wait until a specific time (the time in wait_secs time)
28  goal = WaitGoal(wait_until=(rospy.get_rostime() + rospy.Duration(wait_secs)))
29  client.send_goal(goal)
30  client.wait_for_result()
31 
32  # wait forever (or a really long time at least)
33  goal = WaitGoal()
34  client.send_goal(goal)
35  client.wait_for_result()
